snippet: If Floyd Mayweather Jr. and Manny Pacquiao never fight, boxing fans will be denied a matchup of two of the top stars of their era.
abstract: Greg Bishop On Boxing column on Floyd Mayweather Jr, who remains undefeated after his thrilling victory over Miguel Cotto; asserts that the only real comparison to Mayweather Jr is Manny Pacquiao, and contends that if Mayweather Jr and Pacquiao never fight, boxing fans will be denied a matchup of two of the top stars of their era. Photo (M)
lead_paragraph: LAS VEGAS After his latest victory, Floyd Mayweather Jr. made two related, revelatory statements, neither of which is good for boxing if either or both come true. First, Mayweather noted that his options for future opponents had dwindled to the point that he might not fight again. Then he said what most in boxing have long suspected -- that a megafight with Manny Pacquiao would never happen.

headline.main: After Thrilling Win by Decision Comes Maddening Indecision
